sentences: Doug Henderson is an American musician, producer and mastering engineer based in New York City.
He has been composing and performing since 1985 and has collaborated with a variety of artists and musicians, including John Zorn, Zeena Parkins and Ikue Mori.
Henderson was the leader of two bands, Krackhouse and Spongehead, during the 1980s and 1990s.
He received a Foundation for Contemporary Arts Grants to Artist award (2007).
He received his B.A. in music from Bard College in 1982, during which time he played in a band called Samoans with future Krackhouse member Chris Cochrane.
He received his M.A. from Princeton in 1985 and his Ph.D. in Music Composition from Princeton University in 1991.
